intro: Pyrrocoma pratensis, commonly known as the meadow pyrocoma, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist meadows and grasslands, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a mild, aromatic scent. Pyrrocoma pratensis is a herbaceous perennial that plays a role in supporting local pollinator populations.
